html:
7.19.23  12:52 pm   Why do you think that books are kind of put on a higher "intellectual pedestal" than tv/movies?

     I feel like there's a positive connotation regarding someone who reads a lot of books (well-read, learned, smart, etc.) whereas someone who watches a lot of tv/movies might be seen in a more negative light (tv/movies rot your brain, the person is lazy, etc.).

     I can imagine parents being mad at their kid for sitting around and watching tv or movies (or internet videos) all the time... but if the kid was reading books all the time, the parents would probably brag to all their other parent friends "Oh, Little Timmy is such a smart boy! He loves to read!"

     I think, at the core, books or movies or television or even video games... it's all just different forms/mediums of storytelling? I don't understand why one medium is considered intellectually superior to others?
original_html:

     I can imagine parents being mad at their kid for sitting around and watching tv or movies (or internet videos) all the time... but if the kid was reading books all the time, the parents would probably brag to all their other parent friends "Oh, Little Timmy is such a smart boy! He loves to read!"

7.17.23  10:15 am   7.1.23  11:50 am i've thought about this for the last two weeks and have realized that you're probably correct. i think part of the problem is that there are lots of things i'd like to start rather than just one. for example, i'd love to start a charity for a nonprofit childcare center, but i also want to write stories, make music, and commentate on important issues. i suppose i'm interested in many things, and have no idea on where to focus my energy on, especially considering that i have no experience in any of these respects. this became more of a rant and less of a question, but i've always looked up to your creativity and would love your feedback. 

      list them all, describe them all, and figure out what the tangible next step is for each one. you don't have to do it, but start describing the actual tangible next steps for each one. the good news here is you don't have to do anything. you can just spend the day fantasizing about how you could do all these things you want to do
original_html: 7.18.23  7:11 pm   at 7.17.23  10:15 am the link shows the question that it's referring to and also another question below it, is this on purpose
